headline: U.S. Oil Majors Slash Jobs Despite Trump’s Fossil Fuel Push
summary: Despite Trump’s support for fossil fuel expansion, U.S. oil majors are cutting thousands of jobs as low oil prices and megamerger costs squeeze profits.

raw.headline: U.S. Oil Majors Slash Jobs Despite Trump’s Fossil Fuel Push
raw.summary: Despite Trump’s support for fossil fuel expansion, U.S. oil majors are cutting thousands of jobs as low oil prices and megamerger costs squeeze profits.

headline: What Recent Oil Price Swings Mean for ConocoPhillips Stock Valuation in 2025
summary: Thinking about what to do with ConocoPhillips stock? You are not alone. After all, energy stocks like this often feature in portfolios when investors hunt for both growth and value. Even though the last year has seen the stock pull back, with a -7.8% return, and performance for 2024 to date sitting at -7.6%, there is a lot more to the story than just those numbers. Over the last five years, ConocoPhillips investors have actually enjoyed a remarkable 209.4% gain, showing significant strength...

headline: This Natural Gas Producer Has a New Strategy to Profit Off LNG. Why It Could Be Risky.
summary: Natural gas is a product that sells for $3 per million British Thermal Units (BTUs) in the U.S., but more than $11 in Europe and Asia for the same amount.  Most natural gas producers have been content with eking out a profit on the $3 payout—but one company is now making a bold play to sell gas directly to Europe and Asia, adding new risks but potentially supersizing its returns.  Pittsburgh-based  EQT  one of the dominant producers in the Appalachian Basin, has signed three contracts over the past three weeks to buy liquefied natural gas from export terminals in Texas and Louisiana.

headline: U.S. Oil Patch Sheds Jobs as Producers Face Weaker Prices
summary: Employment in the industry fell by 1.7% in August, per data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics
